name: RetrieveWorkerTimeBlocks
description:
Retrieve complete time blocks for specified workers.

This tool retrieves complete time blocks for specified workers over a given date range. It excludes incomplete time blocks, time offs, and overtime request blocks. Useful for accessing detailed time tracking information.

parameters.name: start_date_of_time_block_range
parameters.description: The start date of the time block date range in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The start date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: max_response_objects
parameters.description: Maximum number of objects in a response. Defaults to 20; up to 100 allowed.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: start_index_for_pagination
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in the response collection for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: project_phase_ids
parameters.description: An array of Workday IDs for the project plan phases to retrieve time blocks. Specify one or more phase IDs using the IDs returned from the GET /planPhases endpoint.

value_schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project plan phase for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project plan phase query parameters. 
You can use a returned id from the GET /planPhases endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

parameters.name: project_workday_ids
parameters.description: An array of Workday IDs for the project's time blocks. You can specify one or more project IDs, using those returned by the GET /projects endpoint.

value_schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project query parameters.
You can use a returned id from the GET /projects endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

parameters.name: project_plan_task_ids
parameters.description: A list of Workday IDs for project plan tasks. Specify one or more IDs using results from the GET /planTasks endpoint.

value_schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project plan task for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project plan task query parameters.
You can use a returned id from the GET /planTasks endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

parameters.name: approval_status_ids
parameters.description: Array of Workday IDs representing the approval status of the worker time block. Valid IDs include Submitted, Unsubmitted, Approved, Denied, and Sent Back.

value_schema.description:
The Workday ID of the approval status of the worker time block. Valid IDs are:

* Submitted: dd817fe688db4ac7bf84e3ef79f72948

* Unsubmitted (Not Submitted): ddf5968e6d4430ca4bce9a4cfaba337

* Approved: 0391102bd1b542538d996936c8fa2fa7

* Denied: 8fee8e9d07554b968bb1f19e679e5a05

* Sent Back: 070b249867f747a19bca64f73eafc9b8

You can specify 1 or more status query parameters.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the time block date range in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The end date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: worker_ids
parameters.description: Array of Workday IDs for the workers' time blocks to retrieve. Specify one or more IDs. Use only IDs accessible to the user.

value_schema.description:
The Workday ID of the worker for the time block. Specify workers that the user has permission to access.
You can specify 1 or more worker query parameters.
You can use returned ids from GET /workers.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The start date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The start date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.
